chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christa M Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: eachother and consecutive to her current sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution ordered $5,028.00 ($4,100.00 to Walmart and $928.00 to US Bank) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision along with surcharges.

Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

No contact with any victim/witness.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christa M Williams in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge and the state moves to strike the repeater allegation. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;
Sentence to run consecutive with each other and consecutive to her current sentence

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*No contact with:  any victim/witness
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $4100 to Walmart and $928 to US Bank (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines to be taken from her prison wages);

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 and $10.00 DRGOD (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
